titleStmt.title: An elegie on the death of George Monck general of his Majesty's forces, Duke of Albmearale, &c. (As it was presented to the late, and most seserving duke his son.) Having appear'd about the same time an extraordinary starr.
titleStmt.author: Freeman, Thornburgh, b. 1648 or 9.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by and for Thomas Ratcliffe, and Thomas Daniel, and are to be sold at their house in New-street, betwixt Shooe-lane and Fetter-lane,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Can thy starrs, Heaven! think thy Monck e're meant".
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.

place.placeName: their house in New-street, betwixt Shooe-lane
